prompt_init: You will receive a text. Your task is to rephrase this text without modifying its meaning. Just output your new text, nothing else. Here is the text:
prompt_update: You will receive a text. Your task is to rephrase this text without modifying its meaning. Just output your new text, nothing else. Here is the text:
initial_story:
The baby suffered a cardiac arrest at the theme park on Thursday

A woman has been arrested on suspicion of neglecting a five-month-old boy who suffered a cardiac arrest at a theme park.

The baby is in a critical condition in hospital following the incident at Legoland Windsor at about 13:00 BST on Thursday, police said.

A 27-year-old woman from Witham, Essex, was arrested on suspicion of neglecting a child to cause unnecessary injury.

She has been released on bail until 26 July.

Det Con Zoe Eele, of Thames Valley Police's Child Abuse Investigation Unit, said: "Firstly, our thoughts are with the family of the boy who is in a critical condition in hospital after suffering a cardiac arrest.

"We are working closely with the team at Legoland Windsor Resort but would like to speak to anyone who have information about this incident, specifically anyone who was queueing for the Coastguard HQ boat ride between around 11.30am and 12:45pm.

"I would ask for the public to please avoid speculation about the incident and to respect the boy's family at this deeply upsetting time."

Police said they are not looking for further suspects in relation to the incident.

In a statement, the theme park said: "On Thursday, a young guest was taken ill... and our fully trained First Aid team administered immediate care until the emergency services arrived.

"We will continue to support Thames Valley Police with their ongoing investigation."

Follow BBC South on Facebook, X, or Instagram. Send your story ideas to south.newsonline@bbc.co.uk or via WhatsApp on 0808 100 2240.

The BBC is not responsible for the content of external sites.
stories:
A five-month-old baby was rushed to hospital after experiencing a cardiac arrest at Legoland Windsor theme park on Thursday, and is currently in critical condition.

A 27-year-old woman from Witham, Essex, has been arrested and released on bail until July 26 on suspicion of neglecting the child, which led to unnecessary harm.

Detective Constable Zoe Eele, from Thames Valley Police's Child Abuse Investigation Unit, expressed sympathy for the baby's family and appealed to the public for information, particularly from those who were in the queue for the Coastguard HQ boat ride between 11:30am and 12:45pm on Thursday.

The police are not seeking any additional suspects in connection with the incident and are working closely with the theme park, which provided immediate care to the baby through its fully trained First Aid team until the emergency services arrived.

A five-month-old infant was urgently taken to the hospital after suffering a cardiac arrest at Legoland Windsor theme park on Thursday and remains in a critical state.

A 27-year-old woman from Witham, Essex, was arrested and released on bail until July 26 on suspicion of neglecting the child, resulting in unnecessary harm.

Detective Constable Zoe Eele, from Thames Valley Police's Child Abuse Investigation Unit, offered condolences to the baby's family and requested the public's assistance, particularly from individuals who were waiting in line for the Coastguard HQ boat ride between 11:30am and 12:45pm on Thursday.

The authorities are not currently seeking any additional suspects in connection with the incident and are collaborating closely with the theme park, which provided immediate medical attention to the baby through its fully trained First Aid team until the emergency services arrived.

A five-month-old baby was rushed to hospital on Thursday after experiencing a cardiac arrest at Legoland Windsor, and remains in a critical condition.

A 27-year-old woman from Witham, Essex, was arrested on suspicion of causing harm to the child through neglect, and has been released on bail until July 26.

Detective Constable Zoe Eele of Thames Valley Police's Child Abuse Investigation Unit expressed sympathy to the baby's family and appealed for witnesses, particularly those who were queuing for the Coastguard HQ boat ride between 11:30am and 12:45pm on Thursday.

The investigation is not currently pursuing any other suspects, and is working closely with Legoland Windsor, which provided immediate medical care to the baby through its trained First Aid team until the ambulance arrived.

A 27-year-old woman from Witham, Essex, was taken into custody on suspicion of neglect leading to harm to the child and has been released on bail pending a July 26 court date.

Detective Constable Zoe Eele of Thames Valley Police's Child Abuse Investigation Unit offered condolences to the baby's family and urged anyone who was in line for the Coastguard HQ boat ride between 11:30am and 12:45pm on Thursday to come forward as witnesses.

The current investigation is focused on a single suspect and is working in tandem with Legoland Windsor, whose trained First Aid team provided immediate medical attention to the baby until the ambulance arrived.

The investigation, currently centered on a single suspect, is being carried out in collaboration with Legoland Windsor, whose staff provided vital medical attention to the baby until paramedics arrived.
